CatDescriptText: Murdies Brown, 2174 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: "Children going to high school are not able to because of their age and also because they are trying to get an education. The parents, therefore, should support them until the children find something to do."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Murdies Brown wearing light colored hat with dark buttons, light colored coat with three buttons, and light colored gloves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Thrift Drugs in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
